      18             : 
      19             : // BufferList represents a sequence of buffers of data. A BufferList can choose
      20             : // to own its buffers or not. The class handles writing to the buffers,
      21             : // iterating over them, and reading data out. Unlike SegmentedVector, the
      22             : // buffers may be of unequal size. Like SegmentedVector, BufferList is a nice
      23             : // way to avoid large contiguous allocations (which can trigger OOMs).
      24             : 
      25             : namespace mozilla {
      26             : 
      27             : template<typename AllocPolicy>
      28             : class BufferList : private AllocPolicy
      29             : {
      30             :   // Each buffer in a BufferList has a size and a capacity. The first mSize
      31             :   // bytes are initialized and the remaining |mCapacity - mSize| bytes are free.
      32             :   struct Segment
      33             :   {
      34             :     char* mData;
      35             :     size_t mSize;
      36             :     size_t mCapacity;
      37             : 
      38             :     Segment(char* aData, size_t aSize, size_t aCapacity)
      39             :      : mData(aData),
      40             :        mSize(aSize),
      41        1146 :        mCapacity(aCapacity)
      42             :     {
      43             :     }
      44             : 
      45             :     Segment(const Segment&) = delete;
      46             :     Segment& operator=(const Segment&) = delete;
      47             : 
      48             :     Segment(Segment&&) = default;
      49             :     Segment& operator=(Segment&&) = default;
      50             : 
      51             :     char* Start() const { return mData; }
      52        5101 :     char* End() const { return mData + mSize; }
      53             :   };
      54             : 
      55             :   template<typename OtherAllocPolicy>
      56             :   friend class BufferList;
      57             : 
      58             :  public:
      59             :   // For the convenience of callers, all segments are required to be a multiple
      60             :   // of 8 bytes in capacity. Also, every buffer except the last one is required
      61             :   // to be full (i.e., size == capacity). Therefore, a byte at offset N within
      62             :   // the BufferList and stored in memory at an address A will satisfy
      63             :   // (N % Align == A % Align) if Align == 2, 4, or 8.
      64             :   static const size_t kSegmentAlignment = 8;
      65             : 
      66             :   // Allocate a BufferList. The BufferList will free all its buffers when it is
      67             :   // destroyed. An initial buffer of size aInitialSize and capacity
      68             :   // aInitialCapacity is allocated automatically. This data will be contiguous
      69             :   // an can be accessed via |Start()|. Subsequent buffers will be allocated with
      70             :   // capacity aStandardCapacity.
